| HistoryText             = The Sky-Sharks were a team of fighter pilots who fought for the Allied Forces during [[World War II]]. They were led by [[Lee Bradford (Earth-616)|Captain Lee Bradford]] whose exploits earned him the nickname "Captain Daring". 

In their only recorded wartime adventure, the Sky-Sharks were told to stay in London while Captain Daring and fellow Sky-Shark [[Zeke Mallon (Earth-616)|Zeke Mallon]] participated in a prisoner exchange, trading [[National Socialist German Workers Party (Earth-616)|Nazi]] agent Marshall von Hapz for the captured Colonel Welling. Arriving in Berlin, Daring and Mallon were betrayed and taken prisoner. However, with the aid of double agent Lieutenant Raeger, they managed to escape with Colonel Welling. 

Pinned down by a Nazi Gatling Gun squad at a German airfield, they were rescued by the timely arrival of the other Sky-Sharks who eliminated the Nazis and helped their comrades escape.{{r|U.S.A. Comics Vol 1 7}}

The teams subsequent wartime activities remain unrecorded. 

| Equipment               = 
| Transportation          = Each member of the Sky-Sharks pilot their own fighter planes.
